document.title: CTE Model Curriculum Standards: Building and Construction Trades

1E09845A562E45E09EB95948626C0CBD.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the California Environmental Quality Act (CEQA) and Environmental Impact Review (EIRs) impacts on residential and commercial construction.

D48F872B7F7E48D39DBBFE80E349EA7E.description: Understand the environmental regulations that influence residential and commercial design.

0730E60558CF4662A2AEAA0584732E7E.description: Understand significant historical trends in the construction industry.

6F839454FC59456190A5B8EB9ED42925.description: Recognize the impact of financial, technical, environmental, and labor trends on the past and future of the construction industry.

comments: The Residential and Commercial Construction pathway provides learning opportunities for students interested in preparing for careers in construction and building design, performance, and sustainability. The standards focus on the manner in which residential and commercial structures are designed and built. The pathway includes instruction in the way in which these structures are built (Class B California License).

65FD8E6958614A6B9ECD954827101907.description: Describe the differences between air-conditioning and refrigeration.

09D43EC7637544B381265170A4F16E4B.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the methods and devices used to improve air quality and comfort.

0786B1400B62437189C5EF7313BC8808.description: Mechanical Systems Installation and Repair Pathway
comments: The Mechanical Systems Installation and Repair pathway provides students with competencies fundamental for preparing for employment or advanced training in heating, ventilation, air-conditioning (HVAC) and appliance installation, maintenance, and repair. The pathway includes preparation for a Class C California License and EPA certification.

30A4282EC0694A958C760FD5C5E1463D.description: Identify local and state building codes as appropriate to heavy construction, especially as it relates to highway and bridge projects.

7BF61F55E961432B9C0C2AB9649EAD04.description: Demonstrate understanding of California Environmental Quality Act (CEQA) and Environmental Impact Reports (EIRs) as they apply to heavy construction, including highway and bridge projects.

12CA06CF368B435A87E80D4DCD90F229.description: Understand environmental regulations that influence engineering and heavy construction projects.

A37DA895FAB14E089C5B87DC7E796A08.description: Understand significant historical trends in engineering and heavy construction technology.

EF7F2DC640764612A458539BEAB841F6.description: Understand the impact of financial, technical, and environmental trends on the past and future of the construction industry.

BDF85C9D54164D71983B80148A0BEF93.description: Know the appropriate processes and materials in architectural design, project development, and engineering and heavy construction (e.g., structural, electrical, mechanical, and finish phases).

comments: Demonstrate and apply the knowledge and skills contained in the Building and Construction Trades anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators in classroom, laboratory, and workplace settings, and through the SkillsUSA career technical student organizations.

729FE2DF76BD4486BDEEA15A0DECBDC9.description: Demonstrate the basic care, proper maintenance, and use of hand, portable, and stationary tools related to the Building and Construction trades.

DEC6ED73BCAC450D85C85371DFF546C3.description: Be informed of laws/acts pertaining to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA).

95E4C70999FB4A8C8BEBA899C96CFAE1.description: Maintain a safe and healthful working environment.

95AB9BB332E94565A026955AC74813EA.description: Demonstrate how to prevent and respond to work-related accidents or injuries; this includes demonstrating an understanding of ergonomics.

886E83A9E28349F9917C89BEF55A75F1.description: Practice personal safety when lifting, bending, or moving equipment and supplies.

DA0C990C1474474C86DDC12EE0EBCE60.description: Set up a work area, or shop, to avoid potential health concerns and safety hazards, including but not limited to electrical (shock), wires (tripping), fumes (lung health), noise (hearing loss), fire (burns), and so forth, incorporating ergonomics.

541B5D44AC054FBDA7970B0D9006A4DD.description: Use health and safety practices for storing, cleaning, and maintaining tools, equipment, and supplies.

B2536076385243A4AF6321B5AAE95B98.description: Interpret policies, procedures, and regulations for the workplace environment, including employer and employee responsibilities.

comments: Demonstrate health and safety procedures, regulations, and personal health practices and determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and domain-specific words and phrases as related to the Building and Construction Trades sector workplace environment.

3EE751B7A79B415E9D587E32DD578B2A.description: Interpret information and draw conclusions, based on the best analysis, to make informed decisions.

C922DD0A921348F0897F25FC7266A45C.description: Use systems thinking to analyze how various components interact with each other to produce outcomes in a complex work environment.

D2F3391DFCD84679B7B1365AEB8C0702.description: Solve predictable and unpredictable work-related problems using various types of reasoning (inductive, deductive) as appropriate.

EC4DA18E16BB46ED851720B461C86383.description: Identify and ask significant questions that clarify various points of view to solve problems.

comments: Conduct short, as well as more sustained, research to create alternative solutions to answer a question or solve a problem unique to the Building and Construction Trades sector using critical and creative thinking, logical reasoning, analysis, inquiry, and problem-solving techniques.

1075C07A495A48C4BF6D87986A6F94E9.description: Assess the value of various information and communication technologies to interact with constituent populations as part of a search of the current literature or in relation to the information task.

B64C96EE27D74D3587E48CE810AA2AE8.description: Research past, present, and projected technological advances as they impact a particular pathway.

3D641D331BD14531B6CD095633CFA9F8.description: Discern the quality and value of information collected using digital technologies, and recognize bias and intent of the associated sources.

2CB39B3E260F477294F65165FA909C0D.description: Use information and communication technologies to synthesize, summarize, compare, and contrast information from multiple sources.

0892BC1B32134A038E6A69F66579F0C0.description: Employ Web-based communications responsibly and effectively to explore complex systems and issues.

A794670343B54515987DADF62DB69CC1.description: Use electronic reference materials to gather information and produce products and services.

comments: Use existing and emerging technology to investigate, research, and produce products and services, including new information, as required in the Building and Construction Trades sector workplace environment.

BDB0AFB65FD54110B12D2A953D679E09.description: Develop a career plan that reflects career interests, pathways, and postsecondary options.

D08ACB75CA324A74BB2F40EC34E61AE7.description: Understand how digital media are used by potential employers and postsecondary agencies to evaluate candidates.

63994982EA1F4680A505D00AC3B14A15.description: Recognize the importance of small business in the California and global economies.

006F95FEE5274E9FAD3BCF9B5EA47B51.description: Recognize the role and function of professional organizations, industry associations, and organized labor in a productive society.

EE02FCE2410C4DA9BAFCA0D6DCAB3E52.description: Integrate changing employment trends, societal needs, and economic conditions into career planning.

9CC6EF65C7834D58921234E04FB0F311.description: Research the scope of career opportunities available and the requirements for education, training, certification, and licensure.

920521C3A67B4F0F96F3CE20DFEF6869.description: Explore how information and communication technologies are used in career planning and decision making.

AA5B3A2130F841EBADBC5CF20483D02C.description: Evaluate personal character traits such as trust, respect, and responsibility and understand the impact they can have on career success.

CAE543503B3248EA8B76C265D04CF6FD.description: Identify personal interests, aptitudes, information, and skills necessary for informed career decision making.

comments: Integrate multiple sources of career information from diverse formats to make informed career decisions, solve problems, and manage personal career plans.

80675630C96B47959512665E3BF8952B.description: Advocate and practice safe, legal, and responsible use of digital media information and communications technologies.

64D3FE56531C4275BCC78BBBC0F7D831.description: Communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences using a variety of media and formats.

6393A3FABDA9416A95D558BF8BD0E76C.description: Demonstrate elements of written and electronic communication such as accurate spelling, grammar, and format.

C44D5D08E84948678718D2E3A211DED9.description: Interpret verbal and nonverbal communications and respond appropriately.

E5F1F3DDBB12419CA550EC718DA2BAA9.description: Identify barriers to accurate and appropriate communication.

83423688BFB6433CA63C295D40B48EA0.description: Recognize the elements of communication using a sender–receiver model.

comments: Acquire and accurately use Building and Construction Trades sector terminology and protocols at the career and college readiness level for communicating effectively in oral, written, and multimedia formats.

Analyze and apply appropriate academic standards required for successful industry sector pathway completion leading to postsecondary education and employment. Refer to the Building and Construction Trades academic alignment matrix for identification of standards.
